    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Janni</h1>Jann are genies composed of all four elements, meaning they are not quite home on any of the Elemental Planes. Instead, jann reside on the Material Plane, making only brief forays to the other parts of the Inner Sphere. Although they are human in size and appearance, jann are not at all related to humans and bristle at any claims to this effect. They are a proud people and take great care to maintain their honor—restoring that honor with the edge of a sword, if necessary.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Elemental</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2">Arcana</a></u>, <u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 19<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=211">Janni</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 4</span></h1><span alt="Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral">N</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Elemental Trait" class="trait" title="Elementals are creatures directly tied to an element and native to the Elemental Planes. Elementals don’t need to breathe."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=57">Elemental</a></span><span alt="Genie Trait" class="trait" title="The diverse families of genies hold positions of prominence on the Elemental Planes. They have powerful magical abilities."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=216">Genie</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 162</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +11; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>; one elemental language (Aquan, Auran, Ignan, or Terran), one planar language (Abyssal, Celestial, or Infernal); telepathy 100 feet<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2"><u>Arcana</a></u> +10, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +7, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=16"><u>Survival</a></u> +11<br /><b>Str</b> +4, <b>Dex</b> +2, <b>Con</b> +2, <b>Int</b> +2, <b>Wis</b> +3, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=75"><u>composite shortbow (20 arrows)</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=38"><u>scimitar</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 20, <b>Fort</b> +12, <b>Ref</b> +10, <b>Will</b> +11<br /><b>HP</b> 60; <b>Resistances</b> fire 5<br /><b>Elemental Endurance</b> A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which it takes 1 damage per hour until it leaves or dies.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet, fly 15 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> scimitar +14 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=180"><u>forceful +1</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=194"><u>sweep</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+10 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +14 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188"><u>nonlethal</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d4+10 bludgeoning</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> composite shortbow +12 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly 1d10</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=191"><u>propulsive</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 60 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=254"><u>reload 0</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+5 piercing</span><b>Arcane Innate Spells</b> DC 21; <b>7th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=222">plane shift</a></u></i> (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=52">create food</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></u></i> (x3), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=293">speak with animals</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=53">create water</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Change Size</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=127"><u>polymorph</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) <b>Frequency</b> Once per day. <b>Effect</b> The janni changes a creature’s size. This works as a 4th-level <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=102"><i>enlarge</i></a> or <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=284"><i>shrink</i></a> spell but can target an unwilling creature (DC 21 Fortitude save negates).</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Janni Amirs</h3>Janni amirs can’t grant wishes. They add the following to their innate spells: <b>4th</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=247"><i>read omens</i></a>; <b>Cantrips (4th)</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i> (at will)</a>.<h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=50">Genie</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=212">Djinni</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=214">Efreeti</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=211">Janni</a></td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=215">Marid</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=213">Shaitan</a></td><td>7</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=50">Genie</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 162</i></a><br />A unique type of genie exists for each Elemental Plane, and the bodies of genies are formed out of elemental matter corresponding to their native plane: djinn are formed from wind, clouds, and storms; efreet are fire made flesh; marids are beings of water; and shaitans are composed of metal, gems, and stone. Lastly, the jann are formed out of all four elements, and are the weakest of geniekind. <h2 class="title">Genie Nobles</h2> Genie nobles with titles unique to their kind (as detailed in each sidebar) rule genie society. Genie nobles are generally at least 5 levels higher than a typical example of their kind. In addition to the increased statistics afforded by their higher levels, genie nobles gain additional spells. But the most wondrous (and notorious) of a genie noble’s powers is their ability to grant wishes. Any genie noble (save for jann, who lack this power) can grant a mortal or undead creature up to three wishes within a year’s time. Many unscrupulous creatures compel genie nobles to serve them, tricking them or entrapping them with magic. However, once a genie noble grants a third wish to a single creature, they are freed from service to that creature forever.</span>

      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
